void icmAddBusFetchCallback ( icmBusP  bus,
icmProcessorP  scope,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr,
icmMemWatchFn  writeCB,
void *  userData 
)

Install a callback on fetch accesses using the bus.

Parameters:
bus Bus object.
scope If non-null, restrict sensitivity to this processor.
lowAddr Lowest address of the region to be sensitized.
highAddr Highest address of the region to be sensitized.
writeCB Function to be called.
userData Passed to the callback function.

)

Add a supplementary intercept shared object for a processor.

Returns:
New intercept object.
Parameters:

icmFoundFileFn  cb,

)

Call the given function on all files matching the VLNV specification.

Parameters:

void icmCLParserAdd ( icmCLPP  parser,
const char *  name,
const char *  shortname,
const char *  argDesc,
const char *  group,
icmCLPArgType  type,
void *  ptr,
const char *  description,
Uns32  useMask,
Uns32  userData,
Bool  mandatory 
)

Add an argument to be accepted by this parser. The bit mask is used as follows: If the mask is zero , this argument will always be in the parser. If the mask is non-zero, the argument will be installed if the corresponding bit is set in the parse constructor. The flags are allocated as follows: bit 0 : reserved for internal use. bit 1 : for use in the standard product. bits 2-4 : reserved for internal use. bits 5-31: for use by external tools.

Parameters:
parser Parser.
name Argument name. Must be unique.
shortname Optional argument short name. Must be unique.
argDesc Optional description of the argument value (e.g. filename).
group Optional argument group.
type Argument type.
ptr Pointer to data or function.
description Appears with -help.
useMask Use Mask. See function description.
userData Passed to function.
mandatory This argument must be specified.
void icmCLParserOld ( icmCLPP  parser  ) 

Destroy the parser.

Parameters:
parser Parser.
void icmCLParserUsageMessage ( icmCLPP  parser,
const char *  message 
)

Print this message with -help or if errors are found.

Parameters:
parser Parser.
message General help message.
void icmConnectMMCBus ( icmMmcP  mmc,
icmBusP  bus,
const char *  portName,
Bool  isMaster 
)

Connect an MMC bus port to the bus. 'isMaster' specifies whether the port is a bus master (i.e. written by the MMC) or a slave (read by the MMC).

Parameters:
mmc The MMC to be connected.
bus The bus to be connected.
portName The name of the port on the MMC.
isMaster If true, this is a bus master port, if false this is a slave port.
void icmConnectMemoryToBus ( icmBusP  bus,
const char *  portName,
icmMemoryP  memory,
Addr  lowAddr 
)

Connect a memory object and a bus, using the named memory port.

Parameters:
bus The bus object.
portName Unique name of port created by this call.
memory A memory object already created.
lowAddr Base (decoded) address of the connected memory.
void icmConnectPSEBus ( icmPseP  pse,
icmBusP  bus,
const char *  portName,
Bool  isMaster,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr 
)

Connect a PSE bus port to a bus.

Parameters:
pse The PSE to be connected.
bus The bus to be connected.
portName Name of the port on the PSE. This must exist in the PSE model.
isMaster If True, this is a bus master, otherwise a bus slave. This must match the semantics of the port in the model.
lowAddr Base address on the bus where the port is connected.
highAddr Highest address on the bus where the port is connected.

bus The bus to be connected.
portName Name of the port on the PSE. This must exist in the PSE model.
isMaster If True, this is a bus master, otherwise a bus slave. This must match the semantics of the port in the model.

const char* icmGetVlnvString ( const char *  vlnvroot,
const char *  vendor,
const char *  library,
const char *  name,
const char *  version,
const char *  objType 
)

Synthesize a VLNV path string given the vendor, library, name and version of the library object you wish to load. If models are stored according to Imperas guidelines, this should successfully locate any model. If all arguments are plain strings, constructs a path such as 'vlnvroot/vendor/library/name/version/objtype', otherwise the following rules are used: If vlnvroot is NULL, the default installation path is used. vlnvroot may be a ':' (Linux) or ';' (Windows) separated list of paths. If vendor, library, or name are empty strings (0 is not allowed) or '*', they are treated as wild-cards and all directories are searched. If version is a wild-card, the latest version is taken (note that 1.2.1 is later than 1.2, but FOO is later than both). For success the specification must yield exactly one file. If objType is 'pse', the file pse.pse is used (this is the convention used by Imperas). If objType is 'model' or 'intercept', the file 'model.so' (Linux) or 'model.dll' (Windows) is used. Otherwise, the string is used as is. Note that the name CVS or names that begin with a period are ignored. This function is intended to be used be used by icmNewProcessor, icmNewPSE and icmNewMMC.

Returns:
Null (reports an error) if no unique file is found, otherwise a file path.
Parameters:
vlnvroot Path or list of paths to root of directory(s) containing modelsT.
vendor Vendor directory e.g. yourcompany.com or '*'.
library Library directory e.g. processor or '*'.
name Name directory e.g. risc32 or '*'.
version Version directory e.g. 1.0 or '*'.
objType Filename in the version directory or 'pse' or 'model'.
void icmInitInternal ( const char *  versionString,
icmInitAttrs  simAttrs,
const char *  debugProtocol,
Uns32  dbgPort 
)

Initialize ICM package - call this before any other ICM functions. Please use the macro icmInit().

Parameters:
versionString ICM Version. Checked before ICM is allowed to run.
simAttrs Bit mask of simulation switches.
debugProtocol Specify debug protocol (or null if no debug).
dbgPort Optional host port to connect to debug port.
void icmInitPlatform ( const char *  versionString,
icmInitAttrs  simAttrs,
const char *  debugProtocol,
Uns32  dbgPort,
const char *  platformName 
)

Initialize ICM package and create a named platform. Call this before any other ICM functions.

Parameters:
versionString ICM Version. Checked before ICM is allowed to run. Use the macro ICM_VERSION.
simAttrs Bit mask of simulation switches.
debugProtocol Specify debug protocol (or null if no debug).
dbgPort Optional host port to connect to debug port.
platformName Platform name, appearing in hierarchical component names.
void icmMapExternalMemory ( icmBusP  bus,
const char *  portName,
icmPriv  priv,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr,
icmMemReadFn  readCB,
icmMemWriteFn  writeCB,
void *  userData 
)

Map the passed bus address range using the callbacks.

Parameters:
bus The bus object.
portName Unique name of port created by this call.
priv Access permission on this memory (see icmPriv).
lowAddr Low end of range.
highAddr High end of range.
readCB If specified, will be called for each read.
writeCB If specified, will be called for each write.
userData Passed to each read or write callback.
void icmMapExternalNativeMemory ( icmBusP  bus,
const char *  portName,
icmPriv  priv,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr,
icmMemReadFn  readCB,
icmMemWriteFn  writeCB,
void *  memory,
void *  userData 
)

Map the passed bus address range using the callbacks or locally allocated memory if a callback is absent.

Parameters:
bus The bus object.
portName Unique name of port created by this call.
priv Access permission on this memory (see icmPriv).
lowAddr Low end of range.
highAddr High end of range.
readCB If specified, will be called for each read.
writeCB If specified, will be called for each write.
memory Pointer to space allocated by user (Must be at least as large as 1+hiAddr-lowAddr).
userData Passed to each read or write callback.
void icmMapLocalMemory ( icmBusP  bus,
const char *  portName,
icmPriv  priv,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr 
)

Map the passed bus address range using a local anonymous memory.

Parameters:
bus The bus object.
portName Unique name of port created by this call.
priv Access permission on this memory (see icmPriv).
lowAddr Low end of range.
highAddr High end of range.
void icmMapNativeMemory ( icmBusP  bus,
icmPriv  priv,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  hiAddr,
void *  memory 
)

Map locally allocated memory to a bus.

Parameters:
bus Map the memory onto this bus.
priv Access permission on this memory (see icmPriv).
lowAddr Low extent of the memory.
hiAddr High extent of the memory.
memory Pointer to space allocated by user (Must be at least as large as 1+hiAddr-lowAddr).
icmAttrListP icmNewAttrList ( void   ) 

Create a new attributes list.

Returns:
New user-defined attributes list.
icmBusP icmNewBus ( const char *  name,
Uns8  addressBits 
)

Create a new bus object.

Returns:
New bus object.
Parameters:
name Unique name for this bus.
addressBits Width of the bus in bits.
icmBusBridgeP icmNewBusBridge ( icmBusP  slave,
icmBusP  master,
const char *  bridgeName,
const char *  slavePortName,
const char *  masterPortName,
Addr  lowAddrMaster,
Addr  highAddrMaster,
Addr  lowAddrSlave 
)

Create a bus bridge between the two buses so that the region starting at lowAddrSlave on the slave bus is visible starting at lowAddrMaster in the master bus.

Returns:
Handle to new bridge.
Parameters:
slave Bus on which the bridge receives an access.
master Bus on which the bridge initiates an access.
bridgeName Name of the new bridge.
slavePortName Name of the new bridge bus slave port.
masterPortName Name of the new bridge bus master port.
lowAddrMaster The lowest address generated by the master port.
highAddrMaster The highest address generated by the master port.
lowAddrSlave The lowest address decoded by the slave port.

Uns8  addressBits,
void *  handle 
)

Create a new bus object.

Returns:
New bus object.
Parameters:
name Unique name for this bus.
addressBits Width of the bus in bits.
handle User-defined handle. The handle can be found later using icmGetBusHandle().

icmMmcP icmNewMMC ( const char *  name,
const char *  modelFile,
const char *  modelSymbol,
icmAttrListP  initialAttrs,
void *  handle,
Bool  transparent 
)

Create a new MMC instance running the passed shared object.

Returns:
MMC object.
Parameters:
name New unique name for this MMC instance.
modelFile Path to the MMC model file (see icmGetVlnvString()).
modelSymbol Not unused: Set to null.
initialAttrs List of user defined attributes created using icmNewAttrList() to be used by this model instance.
handle Used by the client.
transparent True if this MMC does not affect the bus traffic, only monitors it.

icmPseP icmNewPSE ( const char *  name,
const char *  modelFile,
icmAttrListP  initialAttrs,
const char *  semiHostFile,
const char *  semiHostSymbol 
)

Create a new PSE instance.

Returns:
New PSE object.
Parameters:
name New unique name for this PSE instance.
modelFile Path to PSE executable file (see icmGetVlnvString()).
initialAttrs List of user-defined attributes for this instance. In the PSE, routines including bhmStringAttribute can be used to retrieve the attributes.
semiHostFile Path to an extension library for this PSE. This argument is not normally required; a PSE will load its own extension if required.
semiHostSymbol Not used. Set to null.
icmPseP icmNewPSEWithHandle ( const char *  name,
const char *  modelFile,
icmAttrListP  initialAttrs,
const char *  semiHostFile,
const char *  semiHostSymbol,
void *  handle 
)

Create a new PSE as above, associating the passed handle with the newly-created PSE.

Returns:
New PSE object.
Parameters:
name New unique name for this PSE instance.
modelFile Path to PSE executable file.
initialAttrs List of user-defined attributes for this instance. In the PSE, routines including bhmStringAttribute can be used to retrieve the attributes.
semiHostFile Path to an extension library for this PSE. This argument is not normally required; a PSE will load its own extension if required.
semiHostSymbol Not used. Set to null.
handle The handle which can be found later using icmGetPSEHandle().

icmProcessorP icmNewProcessor ( const char *  name,
const char *  type,
Uns32  cpuId,
Uns32  cpuFlags,
Uns8  addressBits,
const char *  modelFile,
const char *  modelSymbol,
icmNewProcAttrs  procAttrs,
icmAttrListP  userAttrs,
const char *  semiHostFile,
const char *  semiHostSymbol 
)

Create a new processor instance.

Returns:
New processor object.
Parameters:
name Name of new processor (string will be copied).
type Type of new processor (string will be copied). Corresponds to the N in the VLNV.
cpuId A unique number in the platform for this CPU.
cpuFlags Debug flags passed to the model.
addressBits Width of the address buses (in bits).
modelFile Path to the file containing the model's shared object (see icmGetVlnvString()).
modelSymbol Not used. Set to null.
procAttrs Bit-mask of values from ICM_ATTR_... macros.
userAttrs List of user defined attributes, constructed using icmNewAttrList() etc.
semiHostFile Path to first extension library or null.
semiHostSymbol Not used. Set to null.
icmProcessorP icmNewProcessorWithHandle ( const char *  name,
const char *  type,
Uns32  cpuId,
Uns32  cpuFlags,
Uns8  addressBits,
const char *  modelFile,
const char *  modelSymbol,
icmNewProcAttrs  procAttrs,
icmAttrListP  userAttrs,
const char *  semiHostFile,
const char *  semiHostSymbol,
void *  handle 
)

Create a new processor instance, associating the passed handle with the newly created processor.

Returns:
New processor object.
Parameters:
name Name of new processor (string will be copied).
type Type of new processor (string will be copied). Corresponds to the N in the VLNV.
cpuId A unique number in the platform for this CPU.
cpuFlags Debug flags passed to the model.
addressBits Width of the address buses (in bits).
modelFile Path to the file containing the model's shared object(see icmGetVlnvString()).
modelSymbol Not used. Set to null.
procAttrs Bit-mask of values from ICM_ATTR_... macros.
userAttrs List of user defined attributes, constructed using icmNewAttrList() etc.
semiHostFile Path to first extension library or null.
semiHostSymbol Not used. Set to null.
handle User's handle which can be retrieved using icmGetProcessorHandle().
Bool icmOverride ( const char *  target,
const char *  value 
)

Override the value of a model attribute. This function can be called before the platform is constructed.

Returns:
True if parsed without errors.
Parameters:
target Full path to attribute including platform, instance and attribute names.
value New value as a string which will be converted to the correct type.

const char* icmTryVlnvString ( const char *  vlnvroot,
const char *  vendor,
const char *  library,
const char *  name,
const char *  version,
const char *  objType 
)

Synthesize a VLNV path string given the vendor, library, name and version of the library object you wish to load. Similar to icmGetVlnvString, but does not report errors.

Returns:
Null if no unique file is found, otherwise a file path.
Parameters:
vlnvroot Path or list of paths to root of directory(s) containing modelsT.
vendor Vendor directory e.g. yourcompany.com or '*'.
library Library directory e.g. processor or '*'.
name Name directory e.g. risc32 or '*'.
version Version directory e.g. 1.0 or '*'.
objType Filename in the version directory or 'pse' or 'model'.
